edu.nps.moves.deadreckoning

Class RotationUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.nps.moves.deadreckoning.RotationUtils

  • public class RotationUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation of various algorithms from IEEE Std 1278.1-2012 using Apache Commons Math Rotation class. Uses the convention of passing radian angles in x,y,z axis rotation order (e.g. phi,theta,psi or roll,pitch,yaw) even though that many not be the order of rotation.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • ecef2body

        public static Rotation ecef2body(double phi,
                                 double theta,
                                 double psi)
        Transform a vector from ecef (world) to body coordinates (see IEEE Std. 1278). Equivalent to out = A * in, where A = cos(theta)*cos(psi) cos(theta)*sin(psi) -sin(theta) sin(phi)*sin(theta)*cos(psi)-cos(phi)*sin(psi) sin(phi)*sin(theta)*sin(psi)+cos(phi)*cos(psi) sin(phi)*cos(theta) cos(phi)*sin(theta)*cos(psi)+sin(phi)*sin(psi) cos(phi)*sin(theta)*sin(psi)-sin(phi)*cos(psi) cos(phi)*cos(theta)
        Parameters:
        phi - x'' rotation in radians
        theta - y' rotation in radians
        psi - z rotation in radians
        Returns:
        rotation matrix

      • body2ecef

        public static Rotation body2ecef(double phi,
                                 double theta,
                                 double psi)
        Transform a vector from body to ecef (world) coordinates (see IEEE Std. 1278). Equivalent to out = A * in, where A = cos(theta)*cos(psi) sin(phi)*sin(theta)*cos(psi)-cos(phi)*sin(psi) cos(phi)*sin(theta)*cos(psi)+sin(phi)*sin(psi) cos(theta)*sin(psi) sin(phi)*sin(theta)*sin(psi)+cos(phi)*cos(psi) cos(phi)*sin(theta)*sin(psi)-sin(phi)*cos(psi) -sin(theta) sin(phi)*cos(theta) cos(phi)*cos(theta)
        Parameters:
        phi - x'' rotation in radians
        theta - y' rotation in radians
        psi - z rotation in radians
        Returns:
        rotation matrix

      • ned2body

        public static Rotation ned2body(double roll,
                                double pitch,
                                double yaw)
        Transform a vector from ned to body coordinates (see IEEE Std. 1278). Equivalent to out = A * in, where A = cos(pitch)*cos(yaw) cos(pitch)*sin(yaw) -sin(pitch) sin(roll)*sin(pitch)*cos(yaw)-cos(roll)*sin(yaw) sin(roll)*sin(pitch)*sin(yaw)+cos(roll)*cos(yaw) sin(roll)*cos(pitch) cos(roll)*sin(pitch)*cos(yaw)+sin(roll)*sin(yaw) cos(roll)*sin(pitch)*sin(yaw)-sin(roll)*cos(yaw) cos(roll)*cos(pitch)
        Parameters:
        roll - x'' rotation in radians
        pitch - y' rotation in radians
        yaw - z rotation in radians
        Returns:
        rotation matrix

      • body2ned

        public static Rotation body2ned(double roll,
                                double pitch,
                                double yaw)
        Transform a vector from body to ned coordinates (see IEEE Std. 1278). Equivalent to out = A * in, where A = cos(pitch)*cos(yaw) sin(roll)*sin(pitch)*cos(yaw)-cos(roll)*sin(yaw) cos(roll)*sin(pitch)*cos(yaw)+sin(roll)*sin(yaw) cos(pitch)*sin(yaw) sin(roll)*sin(pitch)*sin(yaw)+cos(roll)*cos(yaw) cos(roll)*sin(pitch)*sin(yaw)-sin(roll)*cos(yaw) -sin(pitch) sin(roll)*cos(pitch) cos(roll)*cos(pitch)
        Parameters:
        roll - x'' rotation in radians
        pitch - y' rotation in radians
        yaw - z rotation in radians
        Returns:
        rotation matrix

      • ecefvec2nedvec

        public static Rotation ecefvec2nedvec(double latitude,
                                      double longitude)
        Transform a vector from ecef to ned coordinates. Equivalent to out = A * in, where A = -sin(lat)*cos(lon) -sin(lat)*sin(lon) cos(lat) -sin(lon) cos(lon) 0 -cos(lat)*cos(lon) -cos(lat)*sin(lon) -sin(lat)
        Parameters:
        latitude - in radians
        longitude - in radians
        Returns:
        rotation matrix

      • nedvec2ecefvec

        public static Rotation nedvec2ecefvec(double latitude,
                                      double longitude)
        Transform a vector from ned to ecef coordinates. Equivalent to out = A * in, where A = -sin(lat)*cos(lon) -sin(lon) -cos(lat)*cos(lon) -sin(lat)*sin(lon) cos(lon) -cos(lat)*sin(lon) cos(lat) 0 -sin(lat)
        Parameters:
        latitude - in radians
        longitude - in radians
        Returns:
        rotation matrix

      • ecefvec2enuvec

        public static Rotation ecefvec2enuvec(double latitude,
                                      double longitude)
        Transform a vector from ecef to enu coordinates. Equivalent to out = A * in, where A = -sin(lon) cos(lon) 0 -sin(lat)*cos(lon) -sin(lat)*sin(lon) cos(lat) cos(lat)*cos(lon) cos(lat)*sin(lon) sin(lat)
        Parameters:
        latitude - in radians
        longitude - in radians
        Returns:
        rotation matrix

      • enuvec2ecefvec

        public static Rotation enuvec2ecefvec(double latitude,
                                      double longitude)
        Transform a vector from enu to ecef coordinates. Equivalent to out = A * in, where A = -sin(lon) -sin(lat)*cos(lon) cos(lat)*cos(lon) cos(lon) -sin(lat)*sin(lon) cos(lat)*sin(lon) 0 cos(lat) sin(lat)
        Parameters:
        latitude - in radians
        longitude - in radians
        Returns:
        rotation matrix

      • rotationThresholdExceeded

        @Deprecated
public static boolean rotationThresholdExceeded(Rotation RA,
                                                            Rotation RD,
                                                            double DRA_ORIENT_THRESH)
        Deprecated. use epsilonQuaternionThreshold
        Check if rotation threshold is exceeded, see IEEE Std 1278.1-2012.
        Parameters:
        RA - rotation matrix
        RD - rotation matrix
        DRA_ORIENT_THRESH - radian threshold
        Returns:
        true if exceeded

      • deltaMatrixThreshold

        public static double deltaMatrixThreshold(double DRA_ORIENT_THRESH)
        Deprecated. Use epsilonQuaternionThreshold(double) and quaternionThresholdExceeded(Rotation, Rotation, double) for efficiency (speed).
        Calculate threshold for matrix trace calculation, see IEEE Std 1278.1-2012.
        Parameters:
        DRA_ORIENT_THRESH - radian threshold
        Returns:
        matrix trace threshold = 2-2*cos(DRA_ORIENT_THRESH)

      • matrixThresholdExceeded

        public static boolean matrixThresholdExceeded(Rotation RA,
                                              Rotation RD,
                                              double delta)
        Deprecated. Use epsilonQuaternionThreshold(double) and quaternionThresholdExceeded(Rotation, Rotation, double) for efficiency (speed).
        Check if matrix threshold is exceeded, see IEEE Std 1278.1-2012.
        Parameters:
        RA - rotation matrix
        RD - rotation matrix
        delta - threshold for 3-trace
        Returns:
        true if exceeded

      • epsilonQuaternionThreshold

        public static double epsilonQuaternionThreshold(double DRA_ORIENT_THRESH)
        Calculate threshold for quaternion calculation, see IEEE Std 1278.1-2012.
        Parameters:
        DRA_ORIENT_THRESH - radian threshold
        Returns:
        quaternion threshold = 1-cos(DRA_ORIENT_THRESH/2)

      • quaternionThresholdExceeded

        public static boolean quaternionThresholdExceeded(Rotation RA,
                                                  Rotation RD,
                                                  double epsilon)
        Check if quaternion threshold is exceeded, see IEE Std 1278.1-2012.
        Parameters:
        RA - rotation matrix
        RD - rotation matrix
        epsilon - threshold for 1-S
        Returns:
        true if exceeded
